creditline: Gift of Carol and William Daniels in memory of David M. Daniels
description: portrait of a heavyset man with thick mustache, PL side to viewer
provenance: Gustave Cahen, Paris; his sale, Drouot, Paris, June 8, 1929. Mrs. Jean Fowles, New York. (Shepherd Gallery, New York); David M. Daniels (New York, 1927-2002); by inheritance to his nephew William C. Daniels, Minneapolis.
text: Henry Monnier was a French caricaturist, playwright, and actor active in the mid-19th century. He devoted the early part of his career to drawing and printmaking, moving on later to concentrate more on theater. His work mostly studied the foibles of the bourgeoisie. He studied with great artists, such as Girodet and Baron Gros. Daumier was also a guiding light. The sitter of this portrait remains unidentified.
title: Three-quarter profile of mustached man, facing left
